meanings.definition: To estimate too highly; to overvalue.
meanings.sent1: Some people overrate their own abilities and end up disappointed.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to overrate a movie based on its trailer.
meanings.sent3: Don't overrate your cooking skills, or you might burn the dinner!
meanings.sent4: She tends to overrate her importance in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the team not to overrate their opponent's skills.

meanings.definition: To give too high a rating or too much credit to.
meanings.sent1: Critics often overrate popular movies, leading to high expectations.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overrate a product before trying it out yourself.
meanings.sent3: He tends to overrate his favorite sports team, even when they lose.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been overrating her friend's reliability all along.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the students not to overrate the difficulty of the upcoming test.
